com.xtracta.supplier.supplierParser

Class CSVApacheParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xtracta.supplier.supplierParser.AbstractSupplierParser
      • com.xtracta.supplier.supplierParser.CSVApacheParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Suppliers

    public class CSVApacheParser
extends AbstractSupplierParser
    Uses CSV apache to parse CSV supplier file. The parsing is done iteratively to avoid reading a big file into memory The CSV file as assumed to have a header equal to "Id,SupplierName". Each CSV entry is assumed to contain two fields a number and the supplier name
    Author:
    firas
    See Also:
    Commons CSV

      Reads the supplier names from the given CSV file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVApacheParser

        public CSVApacheParser(java.lang.String filePath)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the supplier names from the given CSV file. The parsing is done using Apache Commons CSV
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the CSV file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error parsing the file

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Description copied from interface: Suppliers
        Check if there are more suppliers. This method should be always invoked before getNextSupplierName
        Returns:
        true if there are more suppliers, and otherwise false
        See Also:
        Suppliers.getNextSupplierName()

      • getNextSupplierName

        public java.lang.String getNextSupplierName()
        Description copied from interface: Suppliers
        Gets the next supplier name. This method should be invoked only after checking the existence of further supplier names using Suppliers.hasNext()
        Returns:
        the next supplier name
        See Also:
        Suppliers.hasNext()
